page.title: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine

revision.text:
{{For|other films named after Steve Jobs|List of films named after Steve Jobs}} {{Infobox film | name = Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine | image = Steve Jobs The man in the Machine.jpg | alt = | caption = | director = [[Alex Gibney]] | producer = Viva Van Loock
Alex Gibney | writer = Alex Gibney | narrator = Alex Gibney | starring = | music = Will Bates | cinematography = Sam Painter
Yutaka Yamazaki | editing = Michael J. Palmer | studio = [[CNN Films]]
Jigsaw Productions | distributor = [[Magnolia Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|2015|03|14|[[South by Southwest|SXSW]]}} | runtime = 128 minutes[https://www.nytimes.com/movies/movie/478955/Steve-Jobs-The-Man-in-the-Machine/overview Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine (2015)] | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine''''' is a [[documentary film]] about [[Steve Jobs]] directed and produced by [[Alex Gibney]]. After a few festival showings, the film was released to the Internet on September 4, 2015 and in limited release to theaters on September 19, 2015.{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2015/09/05/dark-side-steve-jobs-life-documentary/71771916/|title=Review: 'Machine' shows Steve Jobs' dark side|last=Graham|first=Jefferson|date=September 5, 2015|work=[[USA Today]]|accessdate=September 5, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.avclub.com/review/alex-gibney-takes-bite-out-apple-steve-jobs-man-ma-224650|title=Alex Gibney takes a bite out of Apple in Steve Jobs: The Man In The Machine|last=Murray|first=Noel|date=September 3, 2015|work=[[The A.V. Club]]|accessdate=September 3, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-steve-jobs-review-20150904-column.html|title= Review: 'The Man in the Machine' takes a bite out of Steve Jobs' life|last=Turan|first=Kenneth|date=September 3, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=September 3, 2015}}[http://www.magpictures.com/stevejobsthemaninthemachine/ Official Website] ==Cast== * [[Bob Belleville]] * [[Chrisann Brennan]] * [[Nolan Bushnell]] * Andy Grignon * [[Daniel Kottke]] * [[Fred D. Anderson|Fred Anderson]] * [[Steve Jobs]] (archival) * [[Michael S. Malone]] * [[Regis McKenna]] * [[Michael Moritz]] * [[Joe Nocera]] * [[Jon Rubinstein]] * [[Avie Tevanian]] * [[Sherry Turkle]] * [[Steve Wozniak]] (archival){{cite web|url=http://flickfeast.co.uk/reviews/film-reviews/steve-jobs-man-machine/|title=Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine|last=Knipp|first=Chris|date=September 8, 2015|work=Flickfest.co.uk|accessdate=September 8, 2015}} * Narrator: Alex Gibney{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/festivals/sxsw-film-review-steve-jobs-the-man-in-the-machine-1201452986/|title=SXSW Film Review: ‘Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine’ |last=Chang|first=Justin|date=March 14, 2015|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=March 14, 2015}} ==Cultural references== The documentary features Jobs' 1983 Apple [[keynote address]] introduction to the famous [[1984 (advertisement)|''1984'']] [[Super Bowl XVIII]] advertisement directed by [[Ridley Scott]], during a look at the history of the [[Apple Macintosh]], and includes behind-the-scenes footage of the making of the advertisement. In one segment the documentary shows the [[iPod nano]] advertisement that features Canadian singer [[Feist (singer)|Feist]] performing her single [[1234 (Feist song)|''1234'']] which helped both the nano and song gain notice in popular culture. When examining Apple's iPod and iPhone products, footage from the 1991 [[Wim Wenders]] film ''[[Until the End of the World]]'' is shown to highlight the social implications these products have had on human interaction and isolation. ==Reception== On [[Rotten Tomatoes]] the film has an approval rating of 77%, based on 77 reviews, with an [[Weighted mean|average rating]] of 7.1 out of 10. The site's consensus reads "''Steve Jobs: Man in the Machine'' offers absorbing viewing, even if it doesn't delve deeply into its complex subject."{{ cite web| url =https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/steve_jobs_man_in_the_machine/ | title=Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine | publisher =[[Rotten Tomatoes]] | accessdate= December 6, 2017}} Writing on behalf of Roger Ebert's website, [[Godfrey Cheshire III|Godfrey Cheshire]] awarded the documentary 3 out of 4 stars, praising Gibney's "cinematic virtue" to include some "very emotional interview material that couldn’t be equaled by the printed page" (referring to journalist and author [[Walter Isaacson]]'s biographical book [[Steve Jobs (book)|''Steve Jobs'']]).Godfrey Cheshire (September 4, 2015) {{cite web|url=https://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/steve-jobs-the-man-in-the-machine-2015|title=Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine}} [[Roger Ebert.com]]. Ebert Digital LLC. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.magpictures.com/stevejobsthemaninthemachine|Official Site}} * {{IMDb title|4425064}} * {{rotten-tomatoes|id=steve_jobs_man_in_the_machine|title=Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine}} * {{metacritic film|id=steve-jobs-man-in-the-machine|title=Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine}} {{Steve Jobs}} {{Alex Gibney}} {{CNN Films}} [[Category:2015 films]] [[Category:2015 documentary films]] [[Category:American documentary films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:Documentary films about computer and internet entrepreneurs]] [[Category:Films directed by Alex Gibney]] [[Category:Works about Apple Inc.]] [[Category:Films about Steve Jobs]]
